1.text: Aye, my heart trembleth at this also, and leapeth up out of its place:

2.text: Hear attentively the roar of his voice, and the murmur going forth from his mouth.

3.text: He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency, and holdeth not back the flashes when his voice is heard.

5.text: God thundereth marvellously with his voice, doing great things which we do not comprehend.

6.text: For he saith to the snow, Fall on the earth! and to the pouring rain, even the pouring rains of his might.

7.text: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

8.text: And the wild beast goeth into its lair, and they remain in their dens.

9.text: From the chamber [of the south] cometh the whirlwind; and cold from the winds of the north.

10.text: By the breath of God ice is given; and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

11.text: Also with plentiful moisture he loadeth the thick clouds, his light dispels the cloud;

12.text: And they are turned every way by his guidance, that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the circuit of the earth,

13.text: Whether he cause it to come as a rod, or for his land, or in mercy.

14.text: Hearken unto this, Job; stand still and discern the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Dost thou know how +God hath disposed them, and how he causeth the lightning of his cloud to flash?

16.text: Dost thou know about the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him that is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: How thy garments become warm when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

18.text: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, firm, like a molten mirror?

19.text: Teach us what we shall say unto him! We cannot order [our words] by reason of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be told him if I would speak? if a man [so] say, surely he shall be swallowed up.

21.text: And now [men] see not the light as it gleameth, it is [hidden] in the skies. But the wind passeth by and cleareth them.

22.text: From the north cometh gold; with +God is terrible majesty.

23.text: The Almighty, we cannot find him out: excellent in power, and in judgment, and in abundance of justice, he doth not afflict.

24.text: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
